View Macro Syntax

The view! macro provides a JSX-like syntax for building UI in Rust. It compiles to efficient DOM operations with full type safety.

Basic Syntax

1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3view! {
4    <div class="container">
5        <h1>"Hello, World!"</h1>
6        <p>"Welcome to PhilJS"</p>
7    </div>
8}
i

String Literals

In the view! macro, text content must be quoted. This is different from JSX where text can be unquoted.

HTML Elements

Standard Elements

1view! {
2    // Self-closing elements
3    <br/>
4    <hr/>
5    <input type="text"/>
6    <img src="image.png" alt="Description"/>
7 
8    // Elements with children
9    <div>
10        <span>"Nested content"</span>
11    </div>
12 
13    // Void elements
14    <meta charset="utf-8"/>
15    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"/>
16}

Custom Components

1#[component]
2fn Button(text: String, #[prop(optional)] disabled: bool) -> impl IntoView {
3    view! {
4        <button disabled=disabled>{text}</button>
5    }
6}
7 
8// Usage
9view! {
10    <Button text="Click me".to_string()/>
11    <Button text="Disabled".to_string() disabled=true/>
12}

Attributes

Static Attributes

1view! {
2    <div class="container" id="main">
3        <input type="text" placeholder="Enter text"/>
4        <a href="https://example.com" target="_blank">
5            "External Link"
6        </a>
7    </div>
8}

Dynamic Attributes

1let (class, _) = create_signal("active");
2let (disabled, _) = create_signal(false);
3 
4view! {
5    // Dynamic attribute value
6    <div class=class>
7        "Content"
8    </div>
9 
10    // Boolean attribute
11    <button disabled=disabled>
12        "Button"
13    </button>
14 
15    // Computed attribute
16    <div class=move || if active() { "visible" } else { "hidden" }>
17        "Toggle content"
18    </div>
19}

Class Directives

1let (active, _) = create_signal(true);
2let (highlighted, _) = create_signal(false);
3 
4view! {
5    // Conditional class
6    <div class:active=active>
7        "Active when signal is true"
8    </div>
9 
10    // Multiple conditional classes
11    <div
12        class="base-class"
13        class:active=active
14        class:highlighted=highlighted
15    >
16        "Multiple classes"
17    </div>
18 
19    // Dynamic class expression
20    <div class=move || {
21        let mut classes = vec!["base"];
22        if active() { classes.push("active"); }
23        if highlighted() { classes.push("highlighted"); }
24        classes.join(" ")
25    }>
26        "Computed classes"
27    </div>
28}

Style Directives

1let (color, _) = create_signal("red");
2let (size, _) = create_signal(16);
3 
4view! {
5    // Inline style
6    <div style="color: red; font-size: 16px;">
7        "Styled text"
8    </div>
9 
10    // Dynamic style property
11    <div style:color=color style:font-size=move || format!("{}px", size())>
12        "Dynamic styles"
13    </div>
14}

Properties

1let (value, set_value) = create_signal(String::new());
2let (checked, set_checked) = create_signal(false);
3 
4view! {
5    // prop: prefix for DOM properties (not attributes)
6    <input
7        type="text"
8        prop:value=value
9        on:input=move |ev| set_value(event_target_value(&ev))
10    />
11 
12    // Checkbox with checked property
13    <input
14        type="checkbox"
15        prop:checked=checked
16        on:change=move |_| set_checked.update(|c| *c = !*c)
17    />
18}
!

Attributes vs Properties

Use prop: for DOM properties like value and checked. Use regular attributes for HTML attributes like class and id.

Event Handlers

Basic Events

1view! {
2    // Click event
3    <button on:click=move |_| {
4        log::info!("Button clicked!");
5    }>
6        "Click me"
7    </button>
8 
9    // Input event
10    <input
11        type="text"
12        on:input=move |ev| {
13            let value = event_target_value(&ev);
14            log::info!("Input: {}", value);
15        }
16    />
17 
18    // Form submit
19    <form on:submit=move |ev| {
20        ev.prevent_default();
21        log::info!("Form submitted!");
22    }>
23        <button type="submit">"Submit"</button>
24    </form>
25}

Event Modifiers

1view! {
2    // Prevent default
3    <a href="#" on:click=move |ev| {
4        ev.prevent_default();
5        // handle click
6    }>
7        "Link"
8    </a>
9 
10    // Stop propagation
11    <div on:click=move |_| log::info!("Parent clicked")>
12        <button on:click=move |ev| {
13            ev.stop_propagation();
14            log::info!("Button clicked");
15        }>
16            "Click"
17        </button>
18    </div>
19}

Keyboard Events

1view! {
2    <input
3        type="text"
4        on:keydown=move |ev| {
5            if ev.key() == "Enter" {
6                log::info!("Enter pressed!");
7            }
8        }
9        on:keyup=move |ev| {
10            if ev.key() == "Escape" {
11                log::info!("Escape released!");
12            }
13        }
14    />
15}

Element References

1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn FocusInput() -> impl IntoView {
5    let input_ref = create_node_ref::<Input>();
6 
7    let focus = move |_| {
8        if let Some(input) = input_ref.get() {
9            let _ = input.focus();
10        }
11    };
12 
13    view! {
14        <input type="text" node_ref=input_ref/>
15        <button on:click=focus>"Focus Input"</button>
16    }
17}

Control Flow

Show/Hide

1let (visible, set_visible) = create_signal(true);
2 
3view! {
4    <Show
5        when=move || visible()
6        fallback=|| view! { <p>"Hidden"</p> }
7    >
8        <p>"Visible"</p>
9    </Show>
10 
11    <button on:click=move |_| set_visible.update(|v| *v = !*v)>
12        "Toggle"
13    </button>
14}

For Loops

1let items = vec!["Apple", "Banana", "Cherry"];
2 
3view! {
4    <ul>
5        <For
6            each=move || items.clone()
7            key=|item| item.to_string()
8            children=|item| view! {
9                <li>{item}</li>
10            }
11        />
12    </ul>
13}

Match Expressions

1let (status, _) = create_signal("loading");
2 
3view! {
4    {move || match status() {
5        "loading" => view! { <Spinner/> }.into_view(),
6        "error" => view! { <ErrorMessage/> }.into_view(),
7        "success" => view! { <Content/> }.into_view(),
8        _ => view! { <p>"Unknown"</p> }.into_view(),
9    }}
10}

Fragments

1// Return multiple elements without a wrapper
2view! {
3    <>
4        <h1>"Title"</h1>
5        <p>"Paragraph 1"</p>
6        <p>"Paragraph 2"</p>
7    </>
8}

Spreading Props

1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn MyButton(
5    #[prop(attrs)] attrs: Vec<(&'static str, Attribute)>,
6    children: Children,
7) -> impl IntoView {
8    view! {
9        <button {..attrs}>
10            {children()}
11        </button>
12    }
13}
14 
15// Usage
16view! {
17    <MyButton class="btn" id="submit" disabled=true>
18        "Click me"
19    </MyButton>
20}
